Instruction: In a bowl, mix 2 tablespoons of soy sauce with the cubed tofu. Let it marinate for at least 15 minutes.
Heat 1 tablespoon of sesame oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the marinated tofu and cook until golden brown on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil.
Stir in the minced garlic and ginger, cooking for about 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the julienned carrot, sliced bell pepper, and broccoli florets. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of water to create a slurry.
Add the cooked rice to the pan, along with the tofu, green onions, remaining soy sauce, and cornstarch slurry.
Stir-fry everything together for another 3-4 minutes until heated through.
Drizzle with sriracha sauce and serve with lime wedges on the side.
